alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 1:27AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS ACROSS THE ANCHORAGE HILLSIDE AND TURNAGAIN ARM THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A powerful frontal system moving into the northern Gulf of Alaska Sunday afternoon will bring strong winds through Turnagain Arm and across the Anchorage Hillside through Sunday morning. Sustained winds of 25 to 40 mph are possible with gusts up to 65 mph. The strongest winds gusts will likely be along the Upper Hillside around Glen Alps and through Upper Potter Valley. Gusts to 65 mph are also possible along Turnagain Arm from Bird Point to Potter Marsh. The peak of the strongest winds is expected between 3 AM and 9 AM. Winds are then expected to quickly diminish through Sunday afternoon with snow developing for Sunday evening through early Monday morning.
